Package Network

Class StreamsAndSockets

  • java.lang.Object
    • Network.StreamsAndSockets

  • public class StreamsAndSockets
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static methods for connecting streams via sockets. One can connect a sending stream to a receiving stream.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      StreamsAndSockets​()

      This method establishes a service for listening at some port, transforming the incoming messages and sending them to some other port.

      The method connects a stream to a socket.

    • Method Detail

      • stream2Socket

        public static <T extends java.io.Serializable> void stream2Socket​(java.util.stream.Stream<T> stream,
                                                                  java.net.Socket socket,
                                                                  java.lang.Runnable onClose)
                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        The method connects a stream to a socket. In order to enable lazy access to the stream, the next item from the stream is sent only after the other side of the socket has sent a flag.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the stream's elements. The elements must be serializable
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to be sent into a socket.
        socket - the socket to which the stream is to be connected
        onClose - a piece of code to be run after closing the socket.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the connection fails.

      • socket2Stream

        public static <T extends java.io.Serializable> java.util.stream.Stream<T> socket2Stream​(java.net.Socket socket)
                                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method turns a socket into a stream. The stream reads from the socket until it receives null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the items sent through the socket
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket for receiving objects which are sent to the stream.
        Returns:
        a socket which reads from the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the connection fails.

      • computeService

        public static <In extends java.io.Serializable,Out extends java.io.Serializable> void computeService​(java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket,
                                                                                                     int remotePort,
                                                                                                     java.util.function.Function function)
                                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method establishes a service for listening at some port, transforming the incoming messages and sending them to some other port. The method waits for connections and starts a thread for each connection. The waiting can be stopped by closing the serverSocket.
        Type Parameters:
        In - type of the incoming data.
        Out - type of the outgoing data.
        Parameters:
        serverSocket - the socket where the service waits for connections.
        remotePort - the port number where to send the results of the transformation.
        function - the function that transforms the data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if some transmission error occurs.
